snippet: The Federal Trade Commission has been investigating companies that appear to be offering to sell consumer data to screen job candidates, determine eligibility for insurance or make offers of credit.
abstract: Federal Trade Commission sends warning to 10 data brokerage firms, telling them their practices, which involve gathering and selling consumer information, could violate federal privacy laws.
lead_paragraph: The Federal Trade Commission has been investigating companies that appear to be offering to sell consumer data to screen job candidates, determine eligibility for insurance or make offers of credit.

headline.main: F.T.C. Warns Data Firms on Selling Information
headline.print_headline: F.T.C. Warns Data Firms On Selling Information
